alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 5:14AM CDT until July 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River at Forgan 8N affecting Beaver County. For the Cimarron River...including Forgan 8N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River at Forgan 8N. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Expect minor overflows of low lying banks along the cimarron river in northern beaver county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.0 feet Monday evening. - Action stage is 4.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM CDT.
